SPARCED

Model Creation¶

General¶

Main function for model creation

create_model.create_model()[source]¶

Generate Antimony, SBML and AMICI models based on given input data

Parameters:

  • f_observables ([str]) – path to the observables file

  • model_name ([str]) – desired name for the generated Antimony, SBML and AMICI models

  • f_compartments ([str]) – path to the compartments & volumes file

  • f_stoichmatrix ([str]) – path to the stoichiometric matrix file

  • f_output_dir_path ([str]) – path to the desired output directory

  • f_output_parameters ([str]) – path to the output parameters file

  • f_ratelaws – path to the ratelaws file

  • f_ratelaws – [str]

  • f_species ([str]) – path to the species file

  • verbose ([bool]) – verbose

  • is_SPARCED ([bool]) – activate hard-coded behaviors for SPARCED

Returns:

Nothing TODO change this

Return type:

[void]

create_model.launch_model_creation()[source]¶

Small routine to process parsed arguments and call create_model

AMICI¶

Model compilation

model_compilation.compile_sbml_to_amici()[source]¶

Compile the given SBML model into an AMICI model

Warning

Passing observables and constant parameters to the importer is currently broken, in the original script too.

Parameters:

  • sbml_file_name – The SBML file path.

  • model_output_dir – Output directory path for the generated AMICI model.

  • f_observables – The observables input file path.

  • compartments – Content of the compartments input file.

  • species – Content of the species input file.

Returns:

Nothing.

Utilities

amici_utils.define_observables()[source]¶

Create observables for the AMICI model

Warning

This function is an adapted copy/paste from the Jupyter Notebook

amici_utils.extract_amici_model_name()[source]¶

Extract the model name from the given AMICI output directory path

Note

The model name is considered to be preceded by the last “amici” prefix found in the file path string.

Parameters:

output_dir_path – The AMICI output directory path.

Returns:

The extracted model name.

Antimony¶

Model writing

model_writing.antimony_write_model()[source]¶

Generate an Antimony file

Provided an empty Antimony file and some SPARCED formatted data on compartments, stoichiometric matrix, ratelaws, and species, generate the content of the Antimony file.

Note

This process also creates a parameters file as an output.

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The name of the empty Antimony file to write in.

  • f_compartments – The name of the input compartments file.

  • f_stoichmatrix – The name of the input schiochiometric matrix file.

  • f_output_parameters – The name of the output parameters file.

  • f_ratelaws – The name of the input ratelaws file.

  • f_species – The name of the input species file.

  • is_SPARCED – A flag to raise SPARCED specific behavior or not.

Returns:

The contents of the compartments and species files.

General Utilities

antimony_utils.extract_antimony_model_name()[source]¶

Extract the model name from the given Antimony file path

Note

The model name is considered to be preceded by the last “ant_” prefix found and followed by the first dot “.” found in the file path string.

Parameters:

f_antimony – The name of the Antimony file.

Returns:

The extracted model name.

Writing Utilities

antimony_write.antimony_write_constant_variables()[source]¶

Write constant variables in the given Antimony file

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

  • constants – The constant variables to declare.

Returns:

Nothing.

antimony_write.antimony_write_compartments_names()[source]¶

Write compartments names in the given Antimony file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Names should be located on the first column of the array.

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

  • compartments – Content of the input compartments file.

Returns:

Nothing.

antimony_write.antimony_write_reactions()[source]¶

Write reactions in the given Antimony file

Warning

This function contains a massive copy/paste from some older code. TODO Clean function and remove hard-coded values.

Parameters:

  • f – The open Antimony file.

  • f_ratelaws – The ratelaws file path.

  • f_stoichmat – The stoichiometric matrix file path.

  • f_outp – The output parameters file path.

Returns:

A typle with the parameters’ names list and the parameters’ values list.

antimony_write.antimony_write_species_names()[source]¶

Write species names and affiliated compartments in the given Antimony file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Species names should be located on the first column of the array. Species compartments should be located on the second column of the array.

Argurments:

f_antimony: The open Antimony file. species: Content of the input species file.

Returns:

Nothing.

antimony_write.antimony_write_unit_definitions()[source]¶

Write unit definitions in the given Antimony file

Warning

This function contains hard-coded values

Parameters:

f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

Returns:

Nothing.

Writing Initial Conditions Utilities

antimony_write_IC.antimony_write_compartments_IC()[source]¶

Write compartments initial conditions in the given Antimony file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Names should be located on the first column of the array. Volumes should be located on the second column of the array.

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

  • compartments – The content of the input compartments file.

Returns:

Nothing.

antimony_write_IC.antimony_write_reactions_IC()[source]¶

Write reactions parameters initial conditions in the given Antimony file

Warning

TODO use only one array for the parameters instead of taking the risk to separate names from values.

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

  • p_names – The parameters names.

  • p_values – The parameters values.

Returns:

Nothing.

antimony_write_IC.antimony_write_species_IC()[source]¶

Write species initial concentrations in the given Antimony file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Species names should be located on the first column of the array. Species concentrations should be located on the third column of the array.

Parameters:

  • f_antimony – The open Antimony file.

  • species – Content of the input species file.

Returns:

Nothing.

SBML¶

Model annotation

model_annotation.sbml_annotate_model()[source]¶

Annotate species and compartments of the given SBML model

Parameters:

  • sbml_file_name – The SBML file path.

  • species – Content of the species input file.

  • compartments – Content of the compartments input file.

Returns:

Nothing.

Utilities

sbml_utils.write_compartments_annotations()[source]¶

Set compartments annotations in the given SBML file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Compartment names should be located on the first column of the array. Annotations should be located on the third column of the array.

Parameters:

  • f_sbml – The loaded SBML file.

  • compartments – Content of the compartments input file.

Returns:

Nothing.

sbml_utils.write_species_annotations()[source]¶

Set species annotations in the given SBML file

Note

The first row is considered as a header, and hence it is skipped. Annotations should be located between the 4th and the last column of the array.

Parameters:

  • f_sbml – The loaded SBML file.

  • species – Content of the species input file.

Returns:

Nothing.
